intro: Dissotis angusii, commonly known as the white-flowered spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. It is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil. Dissotis angusii is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
